com.attributestudios.api.util

Class Localizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.attributestudios.api.util.ConfigurationLoader
      • com.attributestudios.api.util.Localizer

  • public class Localizer
extends ConfigurationLoader
    Constructs a hash map of name / value pairs that represents the contents of a specified localization file. This class also has an identifier used to determine the current language; this should conform to the W3 standard language information style (e.g. en-US).
    Language File Specifications

    The language file is a "UTF-8 w/o BOM"-encoded file that follows a simple name / value pair system of the format:

    [unlocalized-name]=[localized-name]

    Lines that should not be read into the localizer (comments) are designated by ';' or '#' at the beginning of the line. Note that comments may not appear on the same line as a name / value pair. '\' is used to escape special characters. Lines should be delimited by the CR/LF (windows) line endings. They are virtually identical to .properties files.
    Version:
    1.1.0
    Author:
    Bridger Maskrey (maskreybe@live.com)
    Date:
    2014-08-12

    • Field Detail

      • registeredLocalizers

        private static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Localizer> registeredLocalizers
        A map of initialized localizations, populated when the initialize() method is invoked on an instantiated localizer. Localizers in this hash map are defined via their languageID field, and can be accessed thusly via the getLocale(String) method.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • languageID

        private java.lang.String languageID
        The ID of the localizer language.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Localizer

        public Localizer(java.io.InputStream fileStream,
         java.lang.String languageID)
        Constructs a new Localizer. This localizer reads in tags from the specified language properties file
        Parameters:
        fileStream - The stream from which to read the input lang file.
        languageID - The W3 standard language ID used to identify this localization file.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public boolean initialize()
        Sets up the localizer by reading in all of the name / value pairs present in the file represented in the input stream.
        Overrides:
        initialize in class ConfigurationLoader
        Returns:
        Whether or not the initialization was successful.
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • localize

        public java.lang.String localize(java.lang.String unlocalizedKey)
        Translates an unlocalized value into the localized alternative stored in the locale's dictionary.
        Parameters:
        unlocalizedKey - The unlocalized name of the key. If the locale is uninitialized or if the key is not extant in the dictionary, then the key is returned unlocalized.
        Returns:
        The localized version of the unlocalized key.
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        The string value translation function from ConfigurationLoader.

      • getLocale

        public static Localizer getLocale(java.lang.String languageID)
        Returns a locale via the language ID string it was registered with.
        Parameters:
        languageID - The W3 standard language tag supplied when the locale was instantiated.
        Returns:
        The Localizer object stored with the specified language ID.
        Since:
        1.0.0
